stories.title: The fast and the curious: the rise of the running club

stories.text:
Undoubtedly, one major difference between the Android and iOS is the coherent ecosystem that Apple provides among its devices and OSs. But is it something that's unique to Apple, or is it possible to replicate some of it with a mixture of Android and Windows devices?

I like Android, and I like that it's possible to de-google many Android devices using custom ROMs. But I don't think it's possible to de-apple any iDevice (and why would you, because that'd take away all the nice ecosystem features). Still though, I hate it when there's no easy way to share files between Android and Windows even in 2022 (as opposed to AirDrop), there's no way I can "easily" copy my hand-drawn figures on iPad to Windows (as opposed to Hand-off feature between macOS and iOS devices), and there's still no viable alternative to Apple Watch for Android.

This means that despite Apple's greedy pricing and some really great Android phones introduced each year, still, IMO Apple provides a higher value because of its tight ecosystem:

    Value(iPhone) + Value(iPad) + Value(MacBook Pro) < Value(All three)
stories.title: Ask HN: What's the value of Apple's ecosystem to you?

stories.text:
One of my favorites is postcrossing.com - a huge community of people interested in postcards. some 65 million postcards sent, tons of friendships formed, thousands of meetups etc. I'd have never guessed that so many people can be so passionate about postcards - I doubt most young people today have sent/received even a single postcard.

What are some of your favorite corners of the web? There was one site where someone was digitizing tens of thousands of newspapers all by himself, one where a couple (I think) wrote passionately about various plants... I forgot to bookmark them, my bad.

Anyway, please share your favorites and why. Not just websites, apps are good too. I am tired of going to the same websites everyday (reddit, some youtube channels...) - would be nice to discover projects that are primarily born out of passion, unlike the 99.99% of the web whose primary goal is money.
stories.title: Ask HN: Share your fav quirky, weird, interesting websites (like postcrossing)?

stories.text: I'm 23, me and all my friends are alcoholic. I just can't have fun without alcohol. Been looking for solutions to replace alcohol to have fun but I couldn't. How do you have fun without alcohol? Thanks
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you have fun without alcohol?
